Description.summary: Gives a more verbose source revision ID than what Source Link offers and exposes it via an incremental source generator so it can be used in AssemblyInformationalVersionAttributes without MSBuild, allowing use in Unity projects.

Field.name: s_defaultSeparators
Field.summary: The default separators to split a collection of values with.

Method.name: ParseOptions(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.AdditionalText,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
Method.summary: Parses case-insensitive keys, and case-sensitive values from .
Method.param: The file to parse options from.
See .
Method.example: Key1 = = Value1 would be parsed as "key1" being the key, with "= Value1" being the value.
Method.returns: A collection of case-insensitive keys, and case-sensitive values parsed from . Leading, and trailing white space is trimmed from both keys, and values, before parsing.

Method.name: GetValue(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String})
Method.summary: Retrieves a of s from at the key of .
Method.param: The options to retrieve the value from.
The key to retrieve the value with.
The default value to use instead if does not exist in .
Method.returns: The value stored at within . If no such value exists, is used instead.

Method.name: GetValue(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.String)
Method.summary: Retrieves a from at the key of .
Method.param: The options to retrieve the value from.
The key to retrieve the value with.
The default value to use instead if does not exist in .
Method.returns: The value stored at within . If no such value exists, is used instead.

Method.summary: Retrieves an from at the key of .
Method.param: The options to retrieve a value from.
The key to retrieve the value with.
The default value to use instead if does not exist in .
Method.returns: The value stored at within . If no such value exists, is used instead.

Method.name: GetValue``1(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,``0)
Method.summary: Retrieves a from at the key of .
Method.typeparam: The type to parse the value as.
Method.param: The options to retrieve the value from.
The key to retrieve the value with.
The default value to use instead if does not exist in .
Method.returns: The value stored at within . If no such value exists, is used instead.

Method.name: TryParseLine(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
Method.summary: Try to parse , and from .
Method.param: The line to parse a key and value from.
The resulting key, if successful.
The resulting value, if successful.
Method.returns: if is , white space, begins with '#', begins with ';', lacks both a key, and a value, or if the key is white space. Otherwise , is the case-insensitive key, and is the case-sensitive value.

Description.summary: Provides command line utilities, such as executing a command.

Method.name: ExecuteCommandLineCommand(System.String,System.String)
Method.summary: Executes a command via cmd.exe in the desired directory.
Method.param: The command to be passed to cmd.exe.
The directory to run the command on.
Method.returns: The output of the command that was executed.

Method.name: TryGetWorkingDirectory(System.String,System.String@)
Method.summary: Try to get a working directory from a path.
Method.param: The path to try to get the working directory from.
The resulting working directory, if successful.
Method.returns: if a valid working directory was not found. Otherwise , and is the working directory that was found.

Description.summary: Provides helper utilities for source generation, such as making auto-generated code header comments.

Property.name: ToolName
Property.summary: Gets the name of this tool.
Property.value: The name of this tool.

Property.name: ToolVersion
Property.summary: Gets the version of this tool.
Property.value: The version of this tool.

Method.name: MakeAutoGeneratedCodeHeader(System.String)
Method.summary: Makes a code header comment for labelling auto-generated code.
Method.param: The name of the source file that generated the code.
Method.returns: A header comment for labelling auto-generated code as auto-generated when scanning the contents of a source code file.

Method.name: MakeAutoGeneratedFooter(System.String)
Method.summary: Makes a code footer comment for labelling auto-generated code.
Method.param: The name of the class that generated the code.
Method.returns: A footer comment for labelling auto-generated code as auto-generated.

Description.summary: Provides Git related utilities, such as fetching the current branch name.

Property.name: AbbrevMaximum
Property.summary: Gets the maximum amount of hexadecimal digits that a SHA-1 hash can be represented with.
Property.value: The maximum amount of hexadecimal digits that a SHA-1 hash can be represented with.

Method.name: GetVerboseGitDescribe(SwifterTheDragon.VerboseSourceRevisionIdBuilder.SourceGenerator.Core.VerboseGitDescribeConfiguration)
Method.summary: Runs a verbose Git describe commmand, and returns the result.
Method.param: The configuration data for the verbose Git describe command.
Method.returns: The output of the verbose Git describe command, with trailing white space trimmed. If output is blank, then is used instead.

Method.name: GetCurrentGitBranchName(System.String,System.String)
Method.summary: Runs a command to fetch the current Git branch name, and returns the result.
Method.param: The label for a detached HEAD state.
The path to the root directory of the Git repository.
Method.returns: The output of git branch --show-current. If output is blank, then is used instead.

Method.name: GetGitDescribeFallback(System.String,System.String)
Method.summary: Runs a fallback Git describe command, and returns the result.
Method.param: The label for an invalid HEAD state.
The path to the root directory of the Git repository.
Method.returns: The output of git describe --always, with trailing white space trimmed. If output is blank, then is used instead.

Method.name: AddPatterns(System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String},System.String)
Method.summary: Makes a list of pattern arguments.
Method.param: The patterns to be added to the arguments.
The argument taking patterns.
Method.example: Given an argument accepting patterns --match, and patterns pattern1, & pattern2, the resulting string would be --match "pattern1" --match "pattern2".
Method.returns: with added.

Method.name: EscapeMark(System.String)
Method.summary: Escapes backslashes, and double quotation marks for --dirty, and --broken arguments from git describe, then pads the result in double quotation marks.
Method.param: The mark to be escaped.
Method.returns: with backslashes, and double quotation marks escaped, and the resulting value surrounded in double quotation marks.

Method.name: AddReferenceType(SwifterTheDragon.VerboseSourceRevisionIdBuilder.SourceGenerator.Core.GitReferenceType)
Method.summary: Gives a reference type argument.
Method.param: The reference type to be transformed into an argument.
Method.returns: " --tags" if is . " --all" if is . Otherwise, an empty .

Method.name: AddFormatLength(System.String)
Method.summary: Gives arguments that specify the format length.
Method.param: How long the formatted output should be.
Method.returns: If is below 1, then an empty . If is above 0, then is clamped below (inclusive), and " --abbrev= --long" is used. Otherwise (if is not a valid ), then " --long" is used.

Method.name: NormaliseIllegalSemanticVersionCharacters(System.String)
Method.summary: Removes characters not allowed by Semantic Versioning 2.0.0.
Method.param: The text to be normalised.
Method.returns: The normalised string.

Description.summary: Specifies which reference types are being referred to.

Field.name: None
Field.summary: The default value. This should never be used intentionally.

Field.name: AnnotatedTags
Field.summary: Only annotated tags are being referenced.

Field.name: Tags
Field.summary: Both annotated tags, as well as lightweight (non-annotated) tags are being referenced.

Field.name: All
Field.summary: All reference types are being referenced.

Description.summary: Specifies if tags predating, or containing the commit should be used.

Field.name: None
Field.summary: The default value. This should never be used intentionally.

Field.name: PredatesHead
Field.summary: Only use tags that predate HEAD.

Field.name: ContainsHead
Field.summary: Only use tags that contain HEAD.

Description.summary: Specifies which parent commit should be used.

Field.name: None
Field.summary: The default value. This should never be used intentionally.

Description.summary: Configuration data for verbose Git describe commands.

Property.name: DirtyMark
Property.summary: Gets the dirty mark value.
Property.value: The value for the --dirty=[=<mark>] argument, labelling a working tree with local modification.

Property.name: BrokenMark
Property.summary: Gets the broken mark value.
Property.value: The value for the --broken[=<mark>] argument, labelling a corrupt repository.

Property.name: InvalidHeadLabel
Property.summary: Gets the invalid HEAD label.
Property.value: A label for an invalid HEAD state, such as unborn branches.

Property.name: GitReferenceType
Property.summary: Gets the value for the arguments that specify which reference types are allowed.
Property.value: The value for the arguments that specify which reference types are allowed.

Property.name: CandidateAmount
Property.summary: Gets the value for the candidates argument.
Property.value: The value for the --candidates=<n> argument, specifying the amount of most recent tags to describe HEAD with.

Property.name: AbbrevLength
Property.summary: Gets the abbreviation length value.
Property.value: The value for the --abbrev=<n> argument, specifying how many hexadecimal digits of the abbreviated object name to use, suppressing --long if 0.

Property.name: ParentCommitType
Property.summary: Gets the parent commit type value.
Property.value: Specifies if the --first-parent argument should be included, or omitted, controlling if only the first parent of a merge commit should be followed.

Property.name: MatchPatterns
Property.summary: Gets the match patterns value.
Property.value: A collection of patterns for the --match <pattern> argument, specifying glob patterns that references must match.

Property.name: ExcludePatterns
Property.summary: Gets the exclude patterns value.
Property.value: A collection of patterns for the --exclude <pattern> argument, specifying glob patterns that references must not match.

Property.name: GitTagState
Property.summary: Gets the Git tag state value.
Property.value: Specifies if the --contains argument should be included, or omitted, controlling if tags containing HEAD should be used, or tags predating HEAD.

Property.name: GitRepositoryRootDirectoryPath
Property.summary: Gets the Git repository root directory path value.
Property.value: The absolute file path to the Git repository root directory.

Method.name: #ctor
Method.summary: This empty constructor is here solely to reduce accessibility from , down to .

Description.summary: Generates a single file providing the current verbose source revision ID.
